item.title: Kakapo
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

runewings317:

I would highly suggest you don’t do that… People will be able to dump the SQL files then… I would make account creating like through the site but make it so that it saves to 1 character file with the .txt. But anyway, good luck!

Ignore him, he doesnt know what he is talking about, there is no problem if you dont have exploits.

Also, since winterlove uses serialization for saving, you could easily switch to something like this:

package info.rs2asylum.rs2.util.loading;

import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
import java.sql.ResultSet;
import java.sql.Statement;

import info.rs2asylum.rs2.model.players.PlayerData;
import info.rs2asylum.rs2.net.Mysql;

public class MySqlPlayerLoader implements AbstractPlayerLoader {

	@Override
	public boolean save(PlayerData data) {
		try {
			PreparedStatement pStatement = null;
			ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
			ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(baos);
			oos.writeObject(data);
			oos.flush();
			oos.close();
			baos.close();
			Statement statement = Mysql.getConnection().createStatement();
			statement.executeQuery ("SELECT null FROM characters WHERE name = '" + data.getUsername() + "' limit 1");
			ResultSet rs = statement.getResultSet();
			if (!rs.next()) {
				pStatement = Mysql.getConnection().prepareStatement("INSERT INTO characters (name, password, data) VALUES(?, ?, ?)");
				pStatement.setString(1, data.getUsername());
				pStatement.setString(2, data.getPassword());
				pStatement.setBytes(3, baos.toByteArray());
			} else {
				pStatement = Mysql.getConnection().prepareStatement("UPDATE characters SET data = ? WHERE name = ?");
				pStatement.setObject(1, baos.toByteArray());
				pStatement.setString(2, data.getUsername());
			}
			pStatement.executeUpdate();
			pStatement.close();
			return true;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			return false;
		} 
	}

	@Override
	public PlayerData load(String username) {
		PlayerData data = null;
		try {
			ByteArrayInputStream bais;
			ObjectInputStream ois;
			PreparedStatement pStatement;
			pStatement = Mysql.getConnection().prepareStatement("SELECT * FROM characters WHERE name = ? LIMIT 1");
			pStatement.setString(1, username);
			ResultSet rs = pStatement.executeQuery();
			if (rs.next()) {
				bais = new ByteArrayInputStream(rs.getBytes("data"));
				ois = new ObjectInputStream(bais);
				data = (PlayerData) ois.readObject();
				ois.close();
				bais.close();
			}
			pStatement.close();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			return null;
		}
		return data;
	}

}

[quote=“Kakapo, post:5, topic:420096”]What do you mean dump them? I have added some shit i found on wj to prevent SQL injection.

But i may read from text too.

thanks :P[/quote]
He is referring to them using Sql injection to dump the tables out of the database.

Read full topic

item.title: Kakapo
item.dc:creator: @Kakapo Kakapo
item.description:
@Kakapo wrote:

[center]

Note: Kakapo is a bird native to this here New Zealand, I like them. Dont hate </3

What is kakapo?

Server Base: DeltaScape
Client Base: Galkons Refactored (Plain 317 deob)

This will not be hosted, it will be released when I’m done. This server will not be like ones today. Im not really going to work on server content but mainly on stabilizing. My main goal will be converting the saving and loading system so accounts are saved and loaded from a MySQL Database. This will make it easier for me to create a Online Account control panel for the server. This will be released too

At the moment, I have no progress but i will very soon.

Website Progress

Login system - 10%
Username Changing - 0%
Password Changing - 0%
Logout sysetm - 10%
Main page - 50%
Upgrades page - 0%

31/10/11 - Finished index page for logged in users
[b]Server Progress[/b]

Credits so far

Jorzz for his Account management base using MySQL

I will post more later, I am starting the control panel now
[/center]

Read full topic
